e4: Switching to the unbiased reporting policy would enhance the company's credibility and ethical standing, aligning with legal standards and improving transparency. Although it might temporarily confuse some investors, clear communication about the change can mitigate this issue. Over time, this policy will build stronger trust with all stakeholders, potentially leading to a more stable investor base and possibly reducing regulatory risks.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should be transparent, accurate, and compliant with legal and regulatory frameworks. It should present financial performance without manipulation, ensuring all stakeholders, regardless of their level of sophistication, can trust the integrity of the data. Ethical considerations must also include the manner in which changes in policies are communicated to avoid creating opportunities for insider advantage or misleading less informed investors.
e6: How will the management ensure that all investors, particularly retail investors, are clearly informed and understand the change in the earnings reporting policy? What measures will be taken to prevent any initial negative reaction in the stock market due to misunderstandings about the new, no-bias policy?
